diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Guillain-Barre syndrome (previously considered but ruled out)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's symptoms of recurrent symmetrical weakness in lower extremities, supportive findings from laboratory tests including elevated creatinine kinase and abnormal electromyography, along with the identification of a specific mitochondrial DNA mutation (heteroplasmic m3271 T>C mutation) in muscle biopsy, led to the diagnosis of MELAS.
